0.Pros: You get a discount on food.
0.Cons: You have to deal with horrible customers

1.Summary: "Alright, not the best, but its a service job"
1.Pros: Flexable hours for shifts, worked well with being with college and being able to work over breaks.
1.Cons: Hours are cut during "slow" times over the year which causes workers to have to perform several tasks at the same time in order to please customers.

2.Pros: The fast pace generally keeps things from being too boring. No real qualifications needed to get the job. If you don't like a coworker, you probably won't have to wait long until they've quit (unless it's a manager).
2.Cons: Pretty much everything else qualifies as a con.

3.Pros: You have the ability to grow within the companyYou learn different task and its fast pace
3.Cons: Some of the head leaders are real rude, but still be focused

5.Pros: Lots of responsibility fast pacedlearned a lot
5.Cons: cliquesmanagers ridiculing and talking about employees where others can hearneed better training

6.Cons: You get blamed for things that are beyond your control such as the full breakfast menu not being available all day. That's a national thing, not stores.

7.Pros: Mcdonalds has a great training program so it's a great first job if you need to gain experience. It's fast paced and can be fun to work sometimes.
7.Cons: It can be stressful with little reward. The pay is not great, but everybody knows that. I could honestly say a lot more but it really depends on your store and what you make of the job.

8.Pros: Benefits, Coworkers, pay, flexibility for students.
8.Cons: Rude management, rude customers, dirty environment.

9.Cons: They hire too many young people
